item.title: Getting started with java.util.scanner
item.description: Installation or Setup # The java.util.Scanner class is a simple text scanner which can parse primitive types and strings using regular expressions. A Scanner breaks its input into tokens using a delimiter, which by default matches whitespace. java.util.Scanner is part of the Java API, and is therefore included by default with each Java installation. To use Scanner in your code, you first need to specify where it is in Java’s library: Scanner is in the package java.
